xsa:xsa.xsa:authListDef: Arabic in Arabic script = ara-Arab | Arabic in Latin script = ara-Latn | English in Latin script = eng-Latn | Latin in Latin script = lat-Latn | Greek in Greek script = grc-Grek | Hebrew in Hebrew script = heb-Hebr | Hebrew in Arabic script = heb-Arab
Gregorian | Julian | AM | Hijri-shamsi | Hijri-qamari | Coptic-EoM | Alexandrian | Iranian-Yazdigird | Iranian-Jalali | Spanish | Ilahi | Hindu | unknown | other
muhaqqaq | rayhani | naskh | maghribi | bihari | nasta_liq | thuluth | tawqi_ | riqa_ | ghubar | ta_liq | diwani | ruq_ah | siyaqah
cord | alum-tawed skin | parchment | tanned skin | tapes
leather | paper | cloth | textile | leather / paper | leather / cloth | leather / textile | paper / cloth | paper / textile | cloth / textile
check | conservation | description | exhibition | loan | photography | other

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Input a page or folio number or range of numbers. Example output of this annotator: <locus>123r-123v</locus>
xsa:messages.xsa:label: Folio

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator to indicate a line break in the manuscript text. Only use in fields that transcribe text from the manuscript, such as "incipit" or "explicit", etc. This is an empty element, i. e. it does not require any text input. Example: text<lb/>text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: line break

xsa:messages.xsa:help:
Use this annotator to structure text into paragraphs. Input the text for a paragraph in the text input field. Only use in fields that accept descriptive text. Do not use in fields that transcribe text from the manuscript, such as "incipit" or "explicit", etc. Example: text

text within a paragraph

text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: paragraph

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator to indicate a page break in the manuscript text. Only use in fields that transcribe text from the manuscript, such as "incipit" or "explicit", etc. This is an empty element, i. e. it does not require any text input. Example: text<pb/>text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: page break

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator to indicate emphasized (i. e. overlined) text in Arabic manuscript text (text in Arabic script). Only use in fields that transcribe text from the manuscript, such as "incipit" or "explicit", etc. Example: text <hi rend="overline">text</hi> text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: overline

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator to indicate omitted text portions. Use this annotator instead of three dots ("..."). This is an empty element, i. e. it does not require any text input. Example: text <gap reason="omitted"/> text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: ellipsis

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator in all cases where you would use "sic", for example to indicate that an incorrect spelling that you transcribe is found in the manuscript and not a typing error by you. Example: text <sic>text</sic> text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: sic

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator only in the "additions" input field to indicate the type of addition you are describing, such as "marginalia" or "kabikaj". Example: <label>marginalia</label>text text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: label

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator in any textual input field to input any additional remarks relating to the context. Please use sparingly. Example: text text <note>text of note</note>
xsa:messages.xsa:label: note

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator for references to another location in the manuscript or for bibliographical references. Example: text text <ref>Serikoff (2001)</ref> text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: reference

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator for quoted text, i. e. in all cases where you would normally use double quotes or single quotes. Example: text <q>text text</q> text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: quote

xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this annotator to indicate dividers that appear in the manuscript text, such as red dots. Only use in fields that transcribe text from the manuscript, such as "incipit" or "explicit", etc. This is an empty element, i. e. it does not require any text input. Example: text <milestone unit="section"> text
xsa:messages.xsa:label: divider
Library Information
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Information about the library that holds the manuscript in question.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Subcollection
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If the manuscript belongs to a subcollection, select it here.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Alternative shelfmark
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript, such as a former catalogue number.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Shelfmark
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript, such as a former catalogue number.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Type
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript, such as a former catalogue number.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Intellectual part
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Information about the textual content of a work contained in the manuscript (e. g.: author, title, incipit, explicit).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Extent
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the extent of the work, i. e. the folios where the work starts and ends (e. g. "123r - 134v).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: LOC subject headings (text)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select appropriate subject headings for the "work". Type in LOC ids for entries that are not in the list.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Text defective
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate if the text is defective. The default setting is "false", i. e. the text is not defective.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Main language of text
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select one combination of language and script that is most represented.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Author in English
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If there is a known or widely used English transcription of the name, enter it here.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Normalised (AR)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Normalised author name according to Brockelmann "Geschichte der arabischen Litteratur".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Original
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Name of the author of the work as written in the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Patronymic
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the patronymic component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ism
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "ism" part of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Laqab
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "laqab" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Kunya
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "kunya" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ḥiṭāb
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "ẖiṭāb" component of the name, i. e. how the person is addressed.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Nisbah
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "nisbah" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Original
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Title of the work as written in the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Normalised (EN)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Standard title of the work, i. e. the title under which the work is usually known.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Other title
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Translation of the title of this text. Title of this text in Greek or Latin (if it is a standard text and has a well known Greek or Latin title).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Language
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Language of other title

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Basmala
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Transcribe in full the basmala.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Taḥmīd
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Transcribe the ta?m?d in full, or in significant length. Include the number of �Almighty� mentioned in the ta?m?d.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Incipit
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Incipit of the work (in significant length).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Beginning
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Beginning of the text if the actual incipit is missing, or if there is any text near the beginning that is considered significant.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Explicit
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Explicit of the work (in significant length).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ending
xsa:messages.xsa:help: 2-3 lines of the end of the work if the explicit is missing, or if there is any text near the end that is considered significant.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Colophon
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Colophon of the work.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: TOC entry
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter all chapter headings.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Folio
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Number of folio on which the chapter heading appears.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Chapter heading normalised
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Transcribe standard form of chapter heading or other minimal unit heading. If these are not available, only fill in field for chapter heading in original form.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Chapter heading original
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Transcribe chapter heading or other minimal unit heading as written in the work.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Note
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Use this field for general notes about the work.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Codicology
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Codicological and palaeographical description of the manuscript (e. g.: material, binding, decoration, hands).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Support material
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose from the drop down list the material on which the text is written on, such as "chart" for paper, "perg" for vellum or parchment, etc.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Burnished
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicates whether material has been burnished (smoothed or polished).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Watermark
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter a brief description of the watermark(s) that exist, including a reference to Briquet if applicable (within a <ref> annotator).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Number of folios
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the number of folios of the manuscript or manuscript part.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Dimensions of folio
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dimensions of the (physical) folios.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Dimensions of written area
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dimensions of the written area.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Height
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter height of folios in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Height
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter height of written area in mm, not including borders.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Width
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter width of folios in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Width
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter width of written area in mm, not including borders.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Foliation
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Gathering type
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose the type of gathering from the drop down list.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: range
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter folio range if the information provided in the "Gathering type" field only applies to a certain range of folios.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Number of gatherings
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Number of gatherings (quires) in the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Signatures (gathering)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Transcribe signature inscribed on the gathering if it exists.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Note (gathering)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Explain in words the reasons for the absence of information.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Collation formula
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Collation formula, formula for number of leaves in the quires.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Catchwords
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describes the system used to ensure correct ordering of the quires making up a codex or incunable, typically by means of annotations at the foot of the page.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Condition of manuscript
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the general condition of the manuscript. Choose from the 2 entries in the drop down list: "sound", "deteriorated".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Folio (layout info)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the extent (folios from / to) to which the following layout descriptions apply, e. g. 123r - 124v.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Columns
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the number of columns of written text.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: No. of lines
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Number of lines of text on the folio.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Mistara
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If applicable, give the distance between two lines of the mistara in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Line height (mistara)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Height of a line of text on the folio in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: History
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Information related to the history of the manuscript (e. g.: dates, provenance, bibliography).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Support type
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate material used for the support of the binding structure. Only needed if "Sewing support" is "supported".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Furniture
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe any furniture.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Satchel
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If a satchel exists indicate whether leather or paper.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: End bands
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the end bands in general.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Tie
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe any ties.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Sewing support
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter if sewing support is used for the binding structure.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Attached
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate whether the cover is attached to the spine/board.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Material
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate whether material of bookmark is "textile ribbon" or "other".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Material of board
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter material of the board.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Material
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate the type of material used for the covering.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Satchel
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If a satchel exists, indicate if "leather" or "paper".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Primary
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the primary end bands.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Secondary
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the secondary end bands.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Flaps
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate whether there are any flaps.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Spine
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If a spine exists, indicate whether "flush" or "moulded".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Colour
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the colour of the primary end bands.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Colour
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the colour of the secondary end bands.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Tooling
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe any tooling.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Border
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe border or frame around the text.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Miniature
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe illustrations on the page.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Unwan
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe decorated 'unwan.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Rubrication
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe any rubrication.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Other decoration
xsa:messages.xsa:help: List any other decorations on the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Additions
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give any notheworthy additional information, such as marginalia, kabikaj or translations of terms. Format: <label>Marginalia</label>descriptive text <label>Kabikaj</label>descriptive text <label>Translation</label>descriptive text

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Accompanying material
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Contains details of any significant additional material which may be closely associated with the manuscript being described, such as non-contemporaneous documents or fragments bound in with the manuscript at some earlier historical period.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Script
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select type of script used.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Script description
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If necessary, give a more verbose description of the script.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ink colour
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter colour of the ink.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Pace
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Numeric representation of script.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Rubrication
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose "Present" if there is rubrication in the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Monochrome
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose "Present" if manuscript is in one colour only.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Lines
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Number of lines per page.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Density
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Multiply the number of lines by the number of connected units (not individual characters) per line.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ratio of characters
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Measure the ratio between the height of the tallest letter (e. g. Alif) and the width of the widest letter (e. g. Ba), i. e. divide the height by the width and enter the result which should be a decimal number to one decimal place.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Angle of alif
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Measure the angle of connected alif.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Angle of kaf
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Measure the angle of the bar of the letter kaf.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Name of scribe in transliteration
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If there is a known or widely used English transliteration of the name, enter it here.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Original
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Name of the scribe as written in the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Patronymic
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the patronymic component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ism
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "ism" part of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Laqab
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "laqab" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Kunyah
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "kunya" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ḥiṭāb
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "ẖiṭāb" component of the name, i. e. how the person is addressed.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Nisbah
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "nisbah" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Scribal date
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dates as indicated in the colophon or elsewhere in the manuscript (choose era from calendar field).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Librarian date
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dates as determined by the encoder / librarian (choose era from calendar field).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Approximate date
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If the exact date is unknown, give an approximate date in textual form, e. g. "beginning of 15th century" (choose era from calendar field).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Calendar
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select calendar / era.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Calendar
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select calendar / era.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Calendar
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select calendar / era.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Not before
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate earliest date.
Indicate latest date.
xsa:messages.xsa:label: Not after
Colophon of manuscript
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Transcribe the colophon for the whole manuscript in full if one exists.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Provenance / owners / readers
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Input any information about previous owners, etc.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Seal
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe seals of current and previous owners.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Dimensions
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dimensions of covered board.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Height
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter height of the board in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Width
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter width of the board in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Other catalogues
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give references to original catalogue entries from other sources.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Acquisition
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give any descriptive or other information concerning the process by which a manuscript or manuscript part entered the holding institution.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Availability status
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose information about availability of the manuscript from drop down list.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Availability desc.
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If necessary give a more verbose description about the availability of the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Custodial event
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If necessary give a more verbose description of the custodial event.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Type
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose information about the type of any custodial event (e. g. conservation, exhibition, etc.) from drop down list.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Date
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give the date of the custodial event in ISO 8601 format, e. g.: "2010-08-30" (see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Surrogates
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe existing surrogates of the manuscript, or parts of the manuscript, e. g. microfilms, photographs, digital photographs, etc.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Bibl. item
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give bibliographical references of any known descriptions, editions, or other relevant publications.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Scribe in Arabic
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Split the standard form of the scribe's name into its constituent parts as applicable.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Author in Arabic
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Split the standard form of the author name into its constituent parts as applicable.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Codicology (Parts)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Codicological and palaeographical description parts of the manuscript that is different from that of the manuscript as a whole(e. g.: material, binding, decoration, hands).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Support material
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose from the drop down list the material on which the text is written on, such as "chart" for paper, "perg" for vellum or parchment, etc.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Burnished
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicates whether material has been burnished (smoothed or polished).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Watermark
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter a brief description of the watermark(s) that exist, including a reference to Briquet if applicable (within a <ref> annotator).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Number of folios
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the number of folios of the manuscript or manuscript part.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Dimensions of folio
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dimensions of the (physical) folios.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Dimensions of written area
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dimensions of the written area.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Height
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter height of folios in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Height
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter height of written area in mm, not including borders.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Width
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter width of folios in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Width
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter width of written area in mm, not including borders.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Foliation
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Gathering type
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose the type of gathering from the drop down list.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: range
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter folio range if the information provided in the "Gathering type" field only applies to a certain range of folios.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Number of gatherings
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Number of gatherings (quires) in the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Signatures (gathering)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Transcribe signature inscribed on the gathering if it exists.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Note (gathering)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Explain in words the reasons for the absence of information.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Collation formula
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Collation formula, formula for number of leaves in the quires.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Catchwords
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describes the system used to ensure correct ordering of the quires making up a codex or incunable, typically by means of annotations at the foot of the page.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Condition of manuscript
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the general condition of the manuscript. Choose from the 2 entries in the drop down list: "sound", "deteriorated".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Folio (layout info)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the extent (folios from / to) to which the following layout descriptions apply, e. g. 123r - 124v.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Columns
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the number of columns of written text.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: No. of lines
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Number of lines of text on the folio.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Mistara
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If applicable, give the distance between two lines of the mistara in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Line height (mistara)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Height of a line of text on the folio in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: History (Parts)
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Information related to the history of parts of the manuscript that is different from that of the manuscript as a whole (e. g.: dates, provenance, bibliography).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Support type
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate material used for the support of the binding structure. Only needed if "Sewing support" is "supported".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Furniture
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe any furniture.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Satchel
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If a satchel exists indicate whether leather or paper.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: End bands
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the end bands in general.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Tie
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe any ties.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Sewing support
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter if sewing support is used for the binding structure.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Attached
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate whether the cover is attached to the spine/board.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Material
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate whether material of bookmark is "textile ribbon" or "other".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Material of board
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter material of the board.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Material
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate the type of material used for the covering.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Satchel
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If a satchel exists, indicate if "leather" or "paper".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Primary
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the primary end bands.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Secondary
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the secondary end bands.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Flaps
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate whether there are any flaps.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Spine
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If a spine exists, indicate whether "flush" or "moulded".

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Colour
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the colour of the primary end bands.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Colour
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe the colour of the secondary end bands.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Tooling
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe any tooling.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Border
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe border or frame around the text.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Miniature
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe illustrations on the page.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Unwan
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe decorated 'unwan.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Rubrication
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe any rubrication.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Other decoration
xsa:messages.xsa:help: List any other decorations on the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Additions
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give any notheworthy additional information, such as marginalia, kabikaj or translations of terms. Format: <label>Marginalia</label>descriptive text <label>Kabikaj</label>descriptive text <label>Translation</label>descriptive text

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Accompanying material
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Contains details of any significant additional material which may be closely associated with the manuscript being described, such as non-contemporaneous documents or fragments bound in with the manuscript at some earlier historical period.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Script
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select type of script used.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Script description
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If necessary, give a more verbose description of the script.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ink colour
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter colour of the ink.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Pace
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Numeric representation of script.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Rubrication
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose "Present" if there is rubrication in the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Monochrome
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose "Present" if manuscript is in one colour only.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Lines
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Number of lines per page.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Density
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Multiply the number of lines by the number of connected units (not individual characters) per line.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ratio of characters
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Measure the ratio between the height of the tallest letter (e. g. Alif) and the width of the widest letter (e. g. Ba), i. e. divide the height by the width and enter the result which should be a decimal number to one decimal place.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Angle of alif
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Measure the angle of connected alif.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Angle of kaf
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Measure the angle of the bar of the letter kaf.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Name of scribe in transliteration
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If there is a known or widely used English transliteration of the name, enter it here.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Original
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Name of the scribe as written in the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Patronymic
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the patronymic component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ism
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "ism" part of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Laqab
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "laqab" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Kunyah
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "kunya" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Ḥiṭāb
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "ẖiṭāb" component of the name, i. e. how the person is addressed.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Nisbah
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter the "nisbah" component of the name.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Scribal date
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dates as indicated in the colophon or elsewhere in the manuscript (choose era from calendar field).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Librarian date
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dates as determined by the encoder / librarian (choose era from calendar field).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Approximate date
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If the exact date is unknown, give an approximate date in textual form, e. g. "beginning of 15th century" (choose era from calendar field).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Calendar
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select calendar / era.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Calendar
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select calendar / era.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Calendar
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Select calendar / era.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Not before
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Indicate earliest date.
Indicate latest date.
xsa:messages.xsa:label: Not after
Colophon of manuscript
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Transcribe the colophon for the whole manuscript in full if one exists.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Provenance / owners / readers
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Input any information about previous owners, etc.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Seal
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe seals of current and previous owners.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Dimensions
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Dimensions of covered board.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Height
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter height of the board in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Width
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Enter width of the board in mm.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Other catalogues
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give references to original catalogue entries from other sources.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Acquisition
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give any descriptive or other information concerning the process by which a manuscript or manuscript part entered the holding institution.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Availability status
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose information about availability of the manuscript from drop down list.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Availability desc.
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If necessary give a more verbose description about the availability of the manuscript.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Custodial event
xsa:messages.xsa:help: If necessary give a more verbose description of the custodial event.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Type
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Choose information about the type of any custodial event (e. g. conservation, exhibition, etc.) from drop down list.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Date
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give the date of the custodial event in ISO 8601 format, e. g.: "2010-08-30" (see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Surrogates
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Describe existing surrogates of the manuscript, or parts of the manuscript, e. g. microfilms, photographs, digital photographs, etc.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Bibl. item
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Give bibliographical references of any known descriptions, editions, or other relevant publications.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Scribe in Arabic
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Split the standard form of the scribe's name into its constituent parts as applicable.

xsa:messages.xsa:label: Author in Arabic
xsa:messages.xsa:help: Split the standard form of the author name into its constituent parts as applicable.
